Sentencas: Carbon deposition was observed on anode surfaces of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), which was detrimental to the electrochemical performance of SOFCs.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: Here first principle method was employed to investigate the carbon deposition mechanism on M (M = Cu, Ni, Pd and Ti) doped LaCo0.2F0.8O3 anodes.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: Results show that formation energies of oxygen vacancy are reduced by Cu and Pd doping and increased by Ti and Ni doping.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: Carbon adsorption abilities on surface metal atoms are facilitated by surface oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: The highest and lowest migration barriers are obtained on Cu and Pd doped anode surfaces as the adsorbed carbons insert into surface oxygen vacancies, respectively.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: The initial deposited carbon atoms accelerate subsequent carbon deposition energetically.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: While on surface oxygen sites the adsorbed carbon atoms bond with surface oxygen atoms forming CO molecules on all anode surfaces with lower adsorption energies.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: Our results predict that Cu doping has better resistance to carbon deposition.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study

Sentencas: And the increase of difficulty of first carbon deposition is very important for the subsequent carbon deposition.
Titulo: Understanding the mechanism of carbon deposition on perovskite structured LaCo0.2Fe0.8-yMyO3-δ anodes of solid oxide fuel cells: A first principle study
